CREATE TABLE DOCTORS ( doctor_id INTEGER GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY CONSTRAINT Doctor_PK PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, surname VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, med_specialisation VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, position VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, chief_doctor_id INTEGER,
department_id INTEGER NOT NULL, salary DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL )

CREATE TABLE NURSES ( nurse_id INTEGER GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY CONSTRAINT Nurse_PK PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, surname VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, profession VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, chief_nurse_id INTEGER CONSTRAINT FK_chief_nurse REFERENCES NURSES(nurse_id), department_id INTEGER NOT NULL, salary DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL )

CREATE TABLE DEPARTMENTS ( department_id INTEGER GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY CONSTRAINT Departments_PK PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE PATIENTS ( patient_id INTEGER GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY CONSTRAINT patients_PK PRIMARY KEY, main_doctor_id INTEGER NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT FK_maindoctor FOREIGN KEY (main_doctor_id) REFERENCES DOCTORS(doctor_id), department_id INTEGER NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT FK_department FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES DEPARTMENTS(department_id)
)

CREATE TABLE DOCUMENTATION ( patient_id INTEGER GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY, name VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, surname VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, PESEL VARCHAR(11) CONSTRAINT PESEL_LENGTH CHECK (LENGTH(PESEL)>= 11), disease VARCHAR (40) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (patient_id), CONSTRAINT FK_PersonDocumentation FOREIGN KEY (patient_id) REFERENCES PATIENTS(patient_id) )
